content.description: Straight up past 4 bolts, to a small alcove. Take the right hand steep exit out of the alcove (Javelina Cantina takes the left exit out of this alcove). Continue to a rest, then a final tricky bulge to the anchors. Shares the first 4 bolts with Javelina Cantina. Fun climbing.
content.location: Starts at the right end of a slab platform, below the highest part of the crag. Two oak trees sit below this slab.

content.description: Goes straight up a black water streak. Use a small tree to gain the first bolt, then continue straight up on steep rock with big holds, heading slightly right to gain the anchor. Shares the last two bolts with Deer Saloon.
content.protection: 8 bolts, quick lower anchor. Shares anchor and last two bolts with Deer Saloon.
content.location: This route is the leftmost of three route on the slab at the far right side of The Watering Hole. This slab is where the approach path hits the crag.  Start using a small tree, and climb straight up the black streak on the left of the slab.

content.description: Starts right of two oak trees on a slab/platform. Straight up past 4 bolts, then takes the left hand line up a very short steep finger crack out a bulge (Thuggy and Buggy takes the right hand exit after the 4th bolt). Surmount another steep bulge to gain a left facing corner and crack, then up the crack and face to the anchor. Fun and diverse climbing. Good crack technique helps at the crux.  The second to last bolt, below the final corner, has a permadraw. This keeps the draw clippable and the rope running safely to protect the tricky moves over this bulge to gain the upper crack. Less than perfect rock on the lower section, but improving. Closely spaced bolts at the bulges to keep you off the rock below.  Not sure about the grade on this one...
content.protection: 11 bolts, including one permadraw. Quick Lower anchors.
content.location: Starts at the right end of a platform, right of the two oak trees, below the highest part of the crag. Shares the first four bolts with Thuggy and Buggy.

content.description: Fun start to get onto the slab, then roughly straight up until the 5th bolt. After the 5th bolt, traverse left (crux), then straight up and back slightly right to the anchor. Pretty good climbing. After the second bolt, take the left hand series of bolts (right hand bolt line is Beware of Falling Bats).
content.location: Start up the center of the slab, between two black water streaks, at the right hand side of the Watering Hole. Shares first two bolts with Beware of Falling Bats. Also shares last two bolts and anchor with So Many Frogs.

content.description: Fun start over the bulge to get onto the slab. After the first two bolts, take the right hand bolt line, to some easier ground, then up a steeper section to the anchor. Nice steep finish. Shares the start and first two bolts with Deer Saloon.
content.location: Starts at the center of the slab, own the far right side of the Watering Hole - between two black streaks. Onto the slab, and then takes the right hand bolt line after the first two bolts.

content.description: This is a mixed route with 3 bolts and some trad gear. Follows a crack and short face at the left end of the crag. A bit of loose rock, so climb carefully.
content.protection: 3 bolts, small and medium cams. Ring anchors (no quick lower).
content.location: Left end of the crag. Starts off a small platform that can be approached from the left.

climbs.name: Awesome Possum
climbs.fa: JBak, JWod, Don & Karen Wilson, Feb 2022

content.description: 2 nice crux sections make this climb a hoot. Interesting moves on dirty rock (I cleaned a LOT... rain and traffic will help) lead to a pronounced overhang. Tricky, strenuous moves get you to a cool undercling and then some balance moves to easier ground. A minor runout on solid juggy rock gets you to another crux with steep pulling on great edges. And it ain't really over til it's over at the anchor.Both hard sections are above ledgy stuff, so a tight attentive belay is a good idea.My rating may be a sandbag, we'll see what others say. It seems like one of those height-dependent deals.The name has morphed from Climb Scene to Dead Duck (Karen wanted animal names !), to Playing Possum to Awesome Possum.
content.protection: 9 half inch bolts and CT hooks. 1st hanger is currently missing, I will fix that soon. Stick clip 2nd for now.
content.location: Find the big broken tree beneath a ledgy area at the left side of the crag. Ledgy area is sort of a bandshell formation. Look for a big bolt. There it is.

content.description: The Watering Hole is the long, broken formation that you see a few minutes upstream from the road. Its right side has a distinct slab that is bordered by prominent black water streaks, with good quality rock. Moving further left, the rock quality generally decreases, with sections of good and poor rock. The middle section of the crag has the longest routes at the Zoo, with steep bulges and varied movement.
